snippet: A visit by Secretary of State John Kerry was seen as an olive branch and an acknowledgment that Russia is too important to ignore.
abstract: News Analysis; Sec of State John Kerry's visit to Sochi has been widely seen in Russia as acknowledgment that American efforts to isolate country and Pres Vladimir V Putin has not succeeded; Putin seems to have emerged as national hero who has stood up to West and given up nothing after more than year of facing international criticism for seizure of Crimea.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A visit by Secretary of State John Kerry was seen as an olive branch and an acknowledgment that Russia is too important to ignore.

headline.print_headline: Kerry’s Visit Marks Diplomatic Victory, and Affirmation, for Putin
headline.main: A Diplomatic Victory, and Affirmation, for Putin
